article.headline: Gold futures gain over 2% to turn higher for the week
article.body: Gold futures climbed by more than 2% on Friday to turn higher for the week, notching their first weekly gain in three weeks, as investors continued to assess the Federal Reserve's change to its monetary policy strategy. December gold GCZ20, +2.17% rose $42.30, or 2.2%, to settle at $1,974.90 an ounce. The most-active contract is up 1.4% from the week-ago settlement, according to data from FactSet.
